name: places/ChIJu0drqJZZwokRLpC_726LJQ4
formattedAddress: 7 Gay St, New York, NY 10014, USA
adrFormatAddress: 7 Gay St, New York, NY 10014-3536, USA

originalText.text: I was concerned about the other reviews on here that this doctor stops responding to patients, and this is exactly what happened to me. Dr. Delson put me on medication that needed ongoing monitoring, and then stopped responding to my emails requesting next steps. I eventually had to switch to a different doctor to correct the situation. Incredibly unprofessional; I've never experienced a doctor who abandons his patients in this way.

originalText.text:
I have had the distinct pleasure of being a patient of Dr. Delson for the past 8 years. From the onset of our doctor-patient relationship, I have been consistently impressed by his expertise and knowledge in the medical field, a clear indicator of a professional who truly knows his craft.

Dr. Delson’s professionalism is always present, yet it is his unique ability to connect and communicate in a genuinely “real” way that sets him apart. His approach to medicine combines scientific rigor with a deep understanding of his patients’ needs and experiences, demonstrating an uncommon ability to blend technical acuity with compassionate care.

His candid and insightful communication style puts me at ease, fostering a sense of trust and comfort in our interactions. This, coupled with his commitment to providing top-notch medical care, has made my journey with him remarkably rewarding.

In a world where the personal touch in healthcare can sometimes seem lost, Dr. Delson’s authentic and sincere style of practice is a breath of fresh air. I would unreservedly recommend him to anyone in search of a smart, capable, and genuinely empathetic medical professional. Five stars aren’t enough to capture the quality of care provided by Dr. Delson.

originalText.text: Not sure about the other recent reviews as Dr. Delson has seen me during the pandemic and has been communicative via email.  He sent me for bloodwork and followed up in a timely manner.  He takes his time talking with me about my health and always in a calm, kind and caring manner.  I have been a patient of Dr. Delson for 2 years and I feel VERY fortunate to have found him.  I think we need to plan ahead and be extra patient with our providers during this challenging time.

I think we need to plan ahead and be extra patient with our providers during this challenging time.

originalText.text:
I saw him right before COVID took over and locked down the city. He never listened to my heart or took my blood pressure but did send me for blood tests.
After weeks of waiting for the results, he told me that “something didn’t look right” and wanted to send me to an oncologist. Then we all stopped our lives and that was the last I heard from him.
I frantically called and emailed almost daily to find out what was happening and if I needed to worry about having a pre-existing condition. I emailed asking if I should put him down as my doctor of record if I go into the hospital.
Not a frieking word from him.
Finally when I could see another doctor he looked at the blood results and said there was nothing wrong with me. I showed him the emails in which Delson said he wasn’t sure how to read the results of my tests and this doctor questioned his credentials.
For months I lived with the fear that I had a condition which could have been fatal when the only condition I had was choosing the wrong doctor.
Run don’t walk away from this man.

I frantically called and emailed almost daily to find out what was happening and if I needed to worry about having a pre-existing condition. I emailed asking if I should put him down as my doctor of record if I go into the hospital.
Not a frieking word from him.
Finally when I could see another doctor he looked at the blood results and said there was nothing wrong with me. I showed him the emails in which Delson said he wasn’t sure how to read the results of my tests and this doctor questioned his credentials.
For months I lived with the fear that I had a condition which could have been fatal when the only condition I had was choosing the wrong doctor.
Run don’t walk away from this man.

originalText.text: Similar issues to the rest. started off fine. but often wasn't at his office for scheduled appointments. eventually 'ghosted'. irresponsible behavior/unsafe for patients.
